Key Match Events: The Pistons took a tight 99-95 win over the Raptors, avoiding overtime.
Cade Cunningham collected a double-double by dishing out ten assists.
Malik Beasley produced 20 points to lead the Pistons' starting five in scoring for the night.
Pre-Game Insights: The Pistons knew not to sleep on the Raptors, despite them being undermanned and at the bottom of the Eastern Conference.
The Pistons replaced the injured Tim Hardaway Jr with the veteran Malik Beasley.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons remain unbeaten in NBA Cup play, while advancing to 6-8 on the year.
NBA Fans React to the Pistons' Win Over the Raptors with tweets such as 'Mood' and 'Your Detroit Pistons are 2-0 in the NBA Cup'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons had to roll without a key player for their starting five for the second straight game.
For the second straight game, Malik Beasley was shooting lights out.
The last 6 games for the Pistons have been gaining an insane amount of experience in close games in the most condensed period of time I've ever seen.
Others: Jaden Ivey was back in the mix after taking a game off due to an injury.
Cade Cunningham struggled with his shooting, hitting just six shots for 15 points.
